channel.title: [PI] i get this error when launching client :( [PI]
channel.description:
RS2 user client - release #317 java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 1 at Class36.methodCustomAnimations(Class36.java:65) at Animation.unpackConfig(Animation.java:1710) at client.startUp(client.java:7490) at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:33) at client.run(client.java:4686) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
please help i will rep++

item.title: [PI] i get this error when launching client :( [PI]
item.dc:creator: @FusionX FusionX
item.description:
@FusionX wrote:

laakerules:

you are trying to call to a part from an array, the array does not go up to that part. the resulting in an exception. go to class36 line 65 and tell me what method is there by pasteing it into code tags!

65 if(class18.anIntArray342[i3] != 0) { 66 for(int l3 = i3 - 1; l3 > k2; l3--) { 67 if(class18.anIntArray342[l3] != 0) 68 continue; 69 ai[l2] = l3; 70 ai1[l2] = 0; 71 ai2[l2] = 0; 72 ai3[l2] = 0; 73 l2++; 74 break; 75 } 76 }

i really need help with this

item.title: [PI] i get this error when launching client :( [PI]
item.dc:creator: @FusionX FusionX
item.description:
@FusionX wrote:

[quote=“laakerules, post:2, topic:443275”]What base you using, and you have an array that is out of bounds.

so like this.

int arrayZ[10]
int x = 10
arrayZ[9] = 3  ; 
//Below
arrayZ[x] = 4  ;

Under the below is where your error would be, this is en example. since the array starts at 0 and goes to 9 making there be 10 spots in it so doing arrayZ spot 10 would not work as it only goes up to 9 spots.[/quote]

hmmm? i don’t get it, also i’m using meltic Pvp

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] i get this error when launching client :( [PI]
item.dc:creator: @laakerules laakerules
item.description:
@laakerules wrote:

What base you using, and you have an array that is out of bounds.

so like this.

int arrayZ[10]
int x = 10
arrayZ[9] = 3  ; 
//Below
arrayZ[x] = 4  ;

Under the below is where your error would be, this is en example. since the array starts at 0 and goes to 9 making there be 10 spots in it so doing arrayZ spot 10 would not work as it only goes up to 9 spots.
